projects.title: Eagle Exchange
projects.subtitle: A platform for BC students to buy, sell, and exchange goods
projects.source: Created in ISYS 2160 Intro to Programming using Swift for iOS App Development taught by Professor John Gallaugher
projects.description: In this iOS app, students are able to buy, sell, and exchange their personal items such as event tickets and textbooks. Storing all of the information on Google Firebase, unlike traditional goods-exchanging platforms scuh as Facebook, the app gives students a designated place to exchange their personal goods.

projects.title: Dijkstra's Arena
projects.subtitle: A web-based game designed to educate students on Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm
projects.authors: Roger Wang, Anran Du, Jien Li, Xiaoyu Hu
projects.description: Created in Professor Lewis Tseng's Algorithms class, Dijkstra's Arena was the final project demonstrating our knowledge on the newly-learned Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm. The game includes both single-player and multiplayer components and is fun, challenging, and rewarding at the same time.

projects.title: Visualizing Data Using Qt
projects.subtitle: Using SQL to extra data from local then using Qt to represent the data in different diagrams
projects.source: Completed during summer 2019 internship at ZWSoft based in Guangzhou, China
projects.description: In this project, I used Qt to create a pop-up window consisting of multiple diagrams representing values extracted from local data table using SQL.
